newsitem.title: GERMANY: UAL says orders additional Airbus. [CORRECTED 12:45 GMT]
newsitem.headline: UAL says orders additional Airbus. [CORRECTED 12:45 GMT]

text.p: (Corrects to remove statement that UAL had cancelled an order to Boeing, following a later press release issued by UAL)

United Airlines, the U.S. carrier, said on Friday that it has ordered an additional number of aircraft from European manufacturer Airbus. UAL said in a statement released in Bonn that it would add four Airbus 319 and three Airbus 320 planes to an order for 24 A319s placed in August.
UAL said that the orders were part of a general modernisation of its carrier fleet for which it would invest some $5.2 billion to the year 2000 and retire 111 aging aircraft.
